text:
I want to be your friend, and I have this feeling… Last year, there was a moment that felt special, almost like you fell from heaven. I doubt I’ll sleep tonight. Zosimov was worried he might go mad earlier, so we shouldn’t stress him out. 

“What do you mean?” the mother asked, surprised.  
“Did the doctor really say that?” Avdotya Romanovna asked, looking worried.  

“Yeah, but it’s not true at all. He gave him some medicine—a powder, I saw it. And then you showed up… Honestly, it would’ve been better if you came tomorrow. Good thing we left. In an hour, Zosimov will update you on everything. He’s not drunk! And I won’t be either. What made me drink so much? They got me into a debate, those idiots! I swore I’d stop arguing! They just spout nonsense! I almost got into a fight! I left my uncle in charge. Can you believe they want everyone to ditch their individuality? They think it’s progress to be as unlike themselves as possible. If only their nonsense was original, but it’s not…”

“Listen!” Pulcheria Alexandrovna interrupted softly, but it just made him more fired up.  
“What do you think?” Razumihin shouted, even louder, “Do you think I’m mad at them for talking nonsense? Not at all! I actually like it! That’s the one thing that makes us human. You learn the truth through mistakes!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Razumihin expresses his belief that making mistakes is essential to discovering truth and individuality.
